metadata.title: USN-7247-1 -- OpenCV vulnerabilities
metadata.description: It was discovered that OpenCV did not properly manage certain XML data, leading to a NULL pointer dereference. If a user were tricked into loading a specially crafted file, a remote attacker could possibly use this issue to make OpenCV crash, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 18.04 LTS. (CVE-2019-14493)  It was discovered that OpenCV may perform out-of-bounds reads in certain situations. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause OpenCV to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or the execution of arbitrary code. This issue only affected Ubuntu 18.04 LTS. (CVE-2019-16249, CVE-2019-19624)  It was discovered that the QR code module of OpenCV incorrectly processed certain maliciously crafted QR codes. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause OpenCV to crash, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 22.04 LTS. (CVE-2023-2617, CVE-2023-2618)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-7247-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libopencv-calib3d-dev - 4.5.4+dfsg-9ubuntu4+esm1 libopencv-calib3d4.5d - 4.5.4+dfsg-9ubuntu4+esm1 libopencv-contrib-dev - 4.5.4+dfsg-9ubuntu4+esm1 libopencv-contrib4.5d - 4.5.4+dfsg-9ubuntu4+esm1 libopencv-core-dev - 4.5.4+dfsg-9ubuntu4+esm1 libopencv-core4.5d - 4.5.4+dfsg-9ubuntu4+esm1 libopencv-dev - 4.5.4+dfsg-9ubuntu4+esm1 libopencv-dnn-dev - 4.5.4+dfsg-9ubuntu4+esm1 libopencv-dnn4.5d - 4.5.4+dfsg-9ubuntu4+esm1 libopencv-features2d-dev - 4.5.4+dfsg-9ubuntu4+esm1 libopencv-features2d4.5d - 4.5.4+dfsg-9ubuntu4+esm1 libopencv-flann-dev - 4.5.4+dfsg-9ubuntu4+esm1 libopencv-flann4.5d -
